page.title: 17Trade Flintham/Syerston.
page.content: There is a{lack of facilities}in both villages, neither having a shop. A sub post office is housed in a Syerston kitchen bureau. The Elston postmaster brings his post office in a suitcase to Flintham for 2 hours each Thursday, setting up in the Old School kitchen. Post is delivered daily & collected twice a day except Sundays. Milk is delivered daily and the milk man brings bread to order. Free range eggs, vegetables and soft fruit in season are available at several homes. The East Bridgford butcher delivers to Flintham once a week, groceries are delivered to Syerston from Elston. A mobile pork butcher came to Flintham until November 1985 but stopped as it wasn't paying. This has been the pattern over the last few years, with Flintham's shop and various roundsmen not making enough money to keep going.
